quest.name: Hearts on Fire
journal: Lieutenant Edelstein wants you to report to the Flame General.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to Cracked Fist at Camp Bluefog.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.
Raubahn bids you rally the garrison at the Ceruleum Processing Plant as you did at Camp Bluefog. Make your way around the plant and /psych up the green recruits whose resolve appears to be failing.
Your visceral gesticulations have helped the recruits steel themselves for the battle to come. Now go to Lieutenant Edelstein and /psych him up as you did the recruits.

Lieutenant Edelstein admits that the fire of his resolve had grown dim, and thanks you for making it rage anew. With both the Bull of Ala Mhigo and your good self present, the entire garrison is fairly ablaze with determination.

dialogue.name: EDELSTEIN
dialogue.text: General Raubahn would no doubt be pleased to hear from you. You will find him over by the aetheryte.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ever a sight for sore eyes, my friend.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I'm told you worked wonders on the morale of our garrison at Bluefog. I would have you do the same for the troops here.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: They put on a brave face when I'm about, but the fire in their hearts quivers as a candle in the wind. Aye, I can see it in their bearing.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: About the camp, there are green recruits whose resolve falters. Find them, Forename, and rekindle their fighting spirit the way only a hero can.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Once you have seen to the others, go and do the same for Edelstein. No matter what he may claim, the lieutenant would also be better for a bit of rousing. Trust me, I know.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: About the camp, there are green recruits whose resolve falters. Find them, Forename, and rekindle their fighting spirit the way only a hero can.

dialogue.name: ENPC1
dialogue.text: Uwaaaaaah! The Garleans are not near as frightening as you! I'd sooner face a vanguard while naked as my nameday!

dialogue.name: ENPC1
dialogue.text: Er...thank you. I think. Whatever that was, it momentarily distracted me from my woes. <sigh>

dialogue.name: ENPC2
dialogue.text: Ah, the oft-rumored hero... Doubtless you will single-handedly save us all...

dialogue.name: ENPC2
dialogue.text: Your stirring gesticulation has reawakened me to my purpose! Hero or no, I will fight tooth and nail to protect the realm!

dialogue.name: ENPC2
dialogue.text: I should be honored to meet a hero, but I just don't have the will to care...

dialogue.name: ENPC3
dialogue.text: I–I'm fine, t–truly! N–Nothing to w–worry about! Just a m–mild case of b–battlefield nerves!

dialogue.name: ENPC3
dialogue.text: YAAAAAARGH!!! I BREAK MY FAST ON GARLEANS! AND RIGHT NOW, I'M VERY HUNGRY!

dialogue.name: ENPC3
dialogue.text: <gasp> Th–The hero of Cape Westwind! D–Don't look at me! G–Gods, don't look at meeeeee!

dialogue.name: EDELSTEIN
dialogue.text: You would stoke my fighting spirit as you did our recruits'? Hah hah! A kind offer, but hardly necessary. I assure you, the fire in my heart rages as strongly as it ever has.

dialogue.name: EDELSTEIN
dialogue.text: By Rhalgr... Without my realizing it, the fire of my resolve had grown dim. But thanks to you, it burns red-hot once more! If needs be, I shall lay down my life to secure victory for Eorzea!

dialogue.name: EDELSTEIN
dialogue.text: Would that we had the time to get better acquainted, but right now we must focus on the operation. Should we fail, our lives─if indeed we still live─shall never be the same again.
